turns.content: Are there any bike rentals, bike-sharing programs, or bike trails available for residents or visitors in Bridgwater?

Yes, there are several options for bike rentals and bike trails in Bridgwater:

1. On Your Bike - a bike rental shop located in the town center. They offer a range of bikes for adults and children, including mountain bikes and electric bikes.

2. Bridgwater and Taunton Canal - a scenic bike trail that runs for 14 miles along the canal from Bridgwater to Taunton. The trail is mostly flat and perfect for leisurely bike rides.

3. Quantock Hills - a popular destination for mountain biking with over 1,200 acres of woodlands and hills. There are several trails of varying difficulty levels, including the challenging Red Trail and the more family-friendly Blue Trail.

4. Bridgwater Way - a cycling and walking route that connects Bridgwater with the neighboring towns of Taunton and Burnham-on-Sea. The route is mostly flat and runs along quiet country lanes and off-road paths.

5. West Country Cycle Hire - a bike rental service that offers delivery and collection of bikes to locations around Bridgwater and the surrounding area. They have a range of bikes for adults and children, including electric bikes and tandems.
I haven't ridden a bike in years. Do any of these places offer lessons or beginner-friendly trails?

Yes, some of these places do offer beginner-friendly trails and lessons:

1. On Your Bike - They offer advice and guidance to beginners, as well as a range of bikes suitable for first-time riders. They can also provide maps and advice on suitable routes for beginners.

2. Quantock Hills - They have several trails suitable for beginners, such as the Blue Trail, which is a family-friendly trail. They also offer guided rides and mountain bike skills courses for riders of all levels.

3. Bridgwater Way - It is mostly flat and suitable for beginners. The route is well-marked and has several rest stops along the way.

4. West Country Cycle Hire - They offer advice and guidance to beginners and can provide maps of beginner-friendly routes. They also offer a delivery and collection service, so you can start and finish your ride at a location that suits you.

It's always a good idea to check with the bike rental or tour provider beforehand to discuss your level of experience and any concerns you may have. They can provide tailored advice and guidance to ensure you have a safe and enjoyable experience.
Can I take my dog with me while biking along the Bridgwater and Taunton Canal?

Yes, you can take your dog with you while biking along the Bridgwater and Taunton Canal, but it's important to keep your dog under control and on a short leash to avoid any accidents or conflicts with other cyclists or pedestrians. 

Several areas along the canal have designated dog-walking zones, but you should always clean up after your dog and dispose of their waste responsibly. Please note that some areas may have restrictions on dogs or require them to be on a leash at all times, so it's always best to check the local regulations beforehand.
Can I rent a unicycle instead of a bike from On Your Bike? I want to try something different.

Unfortunately, On Your Bike does not offer unicycle rentals. They specialize in traditional bike rentals, including mountain bikes and electric bikes. However, you may be able to find other shops or rental services that offer unicycles in the Bridgwater area. It's worth doing a search online or contacting local bike shops to see if they can recommend any places that offer unicycle rentals.
